text: Calamosaurus was a genus of small theropod dinosaur from the Lower Cretaceous of the Isle of Wight. == Paleobiology == As a possible basal coelurosaur, Calamosaurus would have been a small, agile, bipedal carnivore. Naish et al 2001. estimate the living animal would have been around 3â€“5 meters long (9.8-16.4 feet), with a small head given the build of the neck vertebrae.Naish D; Hutt S. and Martill D.M. 2001. Saurischian dinosaurs 2: theropods. In: Martill D.M., and Naish D. (eds) Dinosaurs of the Isle of Wight. London The Palaeontological Association, 242-309. There is too little material to say much more about it. == References == Category:Dinosaurs of Europe Category:Cretaceous dinosaurs Category:Theropods
title: Calamosaurus
